alert.note: Alert for Cottonwood; Jackson; Murray; Nobles (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 5:51PM CDT until May 12 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Cherokee County in northwestern Iowa... Osceola County in northwestern Iowa... Dickinson County in northwestern Iowa... Northern Buena Vista County in northwestern Iowa... Clay County in northwestern Iowa... O`Brien County in northwestern Iowa... Jackson County in southwestern Minnesota... Eastern Nobles County in southwestern Minnesota... Southeastern Murray County in southwestern Minnesota... Cottonwood County in southwestern Minnesota... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 549 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rushmore to near Melvin to near Sutherland, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Fulda, Round Lake, Peterson and Harris around 600 PM CDT. Lake Park, Everly, Brewster, Royal and Linn Grove around 605 PM CDT. Milford, Okoboji, Sioux Rapids, Wahpeton, West Okoboji, Fostoria and Greenville around 610 PM CDT. Spencer In Clay County, Spirit Lake, Arnolds Park, Heron Lake, Orleans and Webb around 615 PM CDT. Lakefield and Terril around 620 PM CDT. Windom, Jackson In Jackson County, Superior and Kilen Woods State Park around 625 PM CDT. Mountain Lake, Bergen and Bingham Lake around 630 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Moneta, Delft, Dickens, Calumet, Rossie, Alpha, Kinbrae, Wilder, Gillett Grove and Dundee. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across portions of northwestern Iowa and southwestern Minnesota. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
